meanings.definition: An ancient Roman coin worth one quarter of a denarius.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Rome, people used sesterces to buy goods.
meanings.sent2: He inherited a collection of sesterces from his grandfather.
meanings.sent3: The sesterces rolled off the table and into the piggy bank.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a handful of shiny sesterces.
meanings.sent5: The sesterces jingled in his pocket as he walked.

meanings.definition: A sum of money, especially a large amount.
meanings.sent1: She saved up sesterces for a dream vacation.
meanings.sent2: The sesterces he donated made a big difference to the charity.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled sesterces out of his hat instead of rabbits.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was worth more than all the sesterces in the world.
meanings.sent5: The sesterces piled up on the table, a symbol of his success.
